column1: Gualeguay is a city in the province of Entre Ríos
column4: about 226 km from the provincial capital Paraná and 234 km north-west from Buenos Aires. It has a population of about 39
column5: 000 inhabitants as per the 2001 census [INDEC]. It should not be confused with Gualeguaychú (another city
sent by the Viceroy of the Río de la Plata
column6: Juan José de Vértiz y Salcedo. Rocamora was also the official founder of Gualeguaychú and Concepción del Uruguay and the one who named the province Entre Ríos ("Between Rivers"). The new village received the name of San Antonio de Gualeguay because it was under the protection of St. Anthony.

column1: Gualeguay was the birthplace of post-impressionist painter Cesáreo Bernaldo de Quirós and anthropologist Juan Bautista Ambrosetti (both among the best-known Argentines in their fields)
column3: a football player and manager and scorer of the winning goal in the 1986 FIFA World Cup final and Fernando Ayala
column4: a major Argentine cinema director and producer.
